alert.note: Alert for Kootenai; Latah; Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 09 at 8:37PM MDT until June 11 at 5:34AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of North Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah, Bonner, Boundary, Kootenai, Latah and Shoshone. * WHEN...Until Midnight PDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Burn scars in steep terrain will be susceptable to flash flooding. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms producing heavy rain will move through portions of the northern and central Idaho Panhandle this evening. Storms are expected to weaken by late evening and generate less intense rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
